instructions:
One way to convert text messages to numerical values is to use the ASCII (American Standard Code for Information Interchange) character encoding scheme. In ASCII, a character is represented by a byte (8 bits) code. To convert a text message to a numerical value, concatenate together the codes for each character in the message. The resulting binary string is interpreted as an integer written in binary. The table below gives the ASCII codes for a few characters. Use the table to convert each word into an integer.

Chracter ASCII code
P 01010000
s 01110011
w 01110111
d 01100100
I 01001001
N 01001110
question:
(b)

section: Exercise 2.22.1: Converting text to numerical messages.
